co2-calculation: 3.83 kg olives are needed for 1 L of oil. For 1 L of oil 3.66 kg CO2 is in the agricultural phase. To produce 1 kg of olives 3.66/3.83 = 0.956 kg CO2 is emitted. 1 kg olives at retail = 0.956 + 0.61 (transport & packaging) = 1.57 kg CO2 Äq
references: 1. Avraamides & Fatta 2008, Resource consumption and emissions from olive oil production: a life cycle inventory case study in Cyprus -> 1. page 815, part 3.3: 3.66 kg CO2 per liter of olive oil produced relate to agricultural phase. 2. page 813, 3 results: 3.83 kg of olives are required for 1 L of oil2. Schori 2011. Masterarbeit. CO2-Bilanzierung eines Restaurationsbetriebs. -> Page 53 Verpackung & Transport übernommen: 0.61 kg CO2Äq
name: Oliven
